verses.verse: A good name <WH8034> is better <WH2896> than precious <WH2896> oil <WH8081>; and the day <WH3117> of death <WH4194>, than the day <WH3117> of one <WH3205>'s birth.

It is better <WH2896> to go <WH3212> to the house <WH1004> of mourning <WH60> than to go <WH3212> to the house <WH1004> of feasting <WH4960>: for <WH834> that is the end <WH5490> of all men <WH120>; and the living <WH2416> will lay <WH5414> it to his heart <WH3820>.
Sorrow <WH3708> is better <WH2896> than laughter <WH7814>; for by the sadness <WH7455> of the countenance <WH6440> the heart <WH3820> is made glad <WH3190>.
The heart <WH3820> of the wise <WH2450> is in the house <WH1004> of mourning <WH60>; but the heart <WH3820> of fools <WH3684> is in the house <WH1004> of mirth <WH8057>.
It is better <WH2896> to hear <WH8085> the rebuke <WH1606> of the wise <WH2450>, than for a man <WH376> to hear <WH8085> the song <WH7892> of fools <WH3684>.
For as the crackling <WH6963> of thorns <WH5518> under a pot <WH5518>, so is the laughter <WH7814> of the fool <WH3684>: this also is vanity <WH1892>.
Surely extortion <WH6233> maketh the wise man <WH2450> foolish <WH1984>; and a bribe <WH4979> destroyeth <WH6> the understanding <WH3820>.
Better <WH2896> is the end <WH319> of a thing <WH1697> than the beginning <WH7225> thereof <WH750>; and the patient in spirit <WH7307> is better <WH2896> than the proud <WH1362> in spirit <WH7307>.
Be not hasty <WH926> in thy spirit <WH7307> to be angry <WH3707>; for anger <WH3708> resteth <WH5117> in the bosom <WH2436> of fools <WH3684>.
Say <WH559> not thou <WH7223>, What is the cause that the former days <WH3117> were better <WH2896> than these <WH7592>? for thou dost not inquire wisely concerning this <WH2451>.
Wisdom <WH2451> is as good <WH2896> as an inheritance <WH5159>; yea <WH3148>, more excellent is it for them that see <WH7200> the sun <WH8121>.

For wisdom <WH2451> is a defence <WH6738>, even as money <WH3701> is a defence <WH6738>; but the excellency <WH3504> of knowledge <WH1847> is <WH2451>, that wisdom preserveth the life <WH2421> of him that hath it <WH1167>.
Consider <WH7200> the work <WH4639> of God <WH430>: for who can <WH3201> make that straight <WH8626>, which he hath made crooked <WH5791>?

In the day <WH3117> of prosperity <WH2896> be joyful <WH2896>, and in the day <WH3117> of adversity <WH7451> consider <WH7200>; yea <WH430>, God hath made <WH6213> the one side by side <WH5980> with the other <WH1700>, to the end that man <WH120> should not find <WH4672> out anything <WH3972> that shall be after him <WH310>.

All this have I seen <WH7200> in my days <WH3117> of vanity <WH1892>: there is <WH3426> a righteous <WH6662> man that perisheth <WH6> in his righteousness <WH6664>, and there is a wicked <WH7563> man that prolongeth <WH748> his life in his evil-doing <WH7451>.
Be not righteous <WH6662> overmuch <WH7235>; neither make thyself <WH3148> overwise <WH2449>: why shouldest thou destroy thyself <WH8074>?
Be not overmuch <WH7235> wicked <WH7561>, neither be thou foolish <WH5530>: why shouldest thou die <WH4191> before thy time <WH6256>?

It is good <WH2896> that thou shouldest take hold <WH270> of this <WH2088>; yea <WH3240>, also from that withdraw not thy hand <WH3027>: for he that feareth <WH3373> God <WH430> shall come forth from them all <WH3318>.
Wisdom <WH2451> is a strength <WH5810> to the wise <WH2450> man more than ten <WH6235> rulers <WH7989> that are in a city <WH5892>.
Surely there is not a righteous <WH6662> man <WH120> upon earth <WH776>, that doeth <WH6213> good <WH2896>, and sinneth not <WH2398>.
Also take <WH5414> not heed <WH3820> unto all words <WH1697> that are spoken <WH1696>, lest thou hear <WH8085> thy servant <WH5650> curse thee <WH7043>;
for oftentimes <WH6471> also thine own heart <WH3820> knoweth <WH3045> that thou thyself likewise hast cursed <WH7043> others <WH312>.
All this <WH2090> have I proved <WH5254> in wisdom <WH2451>: I said <WH559>, I will be wise <WH2449>; but it was far from me <WH7350>.
That which is <WH7350>, is far off and exceeding deep <WH6013>; who can find it out <WH4672>?

I turned <WH5437> about <WH3820>, and my heart was set to know <WH3045> and to search <WH8446> out <WH1245>, and to seek wisdom <WH2451> and the reason <WH2808> of things <WH3045>, and to know that wickedness <WH7562> is folly <WH3689>, and that foolishness <WH5531> is madness <WH1947>.

And I find <WH4672> more bitter <WH4751> than death <WH4194> the woman <WH802> whose heart <WH3820> is snares <WH4685> and nets <WH2764>, and whose hands <WH3027> are bands <WH612>: whoso pleaseth <WH2896> God <WH430> shall escape <WH4422> from her <WH2398>; but the sinner shall be taken by her <WH3920>.
Behold <WH7200>, this have I found <WH4672>, saith <WH559> the Preacher <WH6953>, laying one <WH259> thing to another <WH259>, to find out <WH4672> the account <WH2808>;

which my soul <WH5315> still seeketh <WH1245>, but I have not found <WH4672>: one <WH259> man <WH120> among a thousand <WH505> have I found <WH4672>; but a woman <WH802> among all those have I not found <WH4672>.
Behold <WH7200>, this only <WH905> have I found <WH4672>: that God <WH430> made <WH6213> man <WH120> upright <WH3477>; but they have sought out <WH1245> many <WH120> inventions <WH2810>.
